item.description:
CSS Grid is a powerful layout system that makes it easy to create complex, responsive designs.

Grid Basics

Learn how to use grid containers and grid items to create layouts.

Advanced Techniques

  • Grid areas
  • Auto-placement
  • Responsive grids

Conclusion

CSS Grid simplifies layout creation and provides more control than traditional methods.
item.title: CSS Grid Layout Mastery

item.title: CSS Grid Layout Mastery

item.description:
React Hooks revolutionized how we write React components. This post introduces the most commonly used hooks.

useState Hook

The useState hook allows you to add state to functional components.

useEffect Hook

useEffect handles side effects in your components, similar to lifecycle methods in class components.

Custom Hooks

You can create your own hooks to share logic between components.

Conclusion

Hooks make React code more concise and easier to understand.
item.title: Introduction to React Hooks

item.description:
A comprehensive guide to choosing between CSS Grid and Flexbox for your layout needs.

Grid vs Flexbox

Both CSS Grid and Flexbox are powerful layout tools, but they serve different purposes.

When to Use Grid

  • Two-dimensional layouts
  • Complex page structures
  • Precise control over rows and columns

When to Use Flexbox

  • One-dimensional layouts
  • Component alignment
  • Responsive navigation bars

Conclusion

Understanding when to use each tool will make your CSS more efficient and maintainable.
item.title: CSS Grid vs Flexbox: When to Use What
